newsitem.title: FRANCE: Alcatel to exit Cofira - Gle des Eaux.
newsitem.headline: Alcatel to exit Cofira - Gle des Eaux.

text.p: Alcatel Alsthom will proceed with plans to sell its 20 percent stake in telecommunications holding Cofira, which it owns along with Generale des Eaux and U.S. and British partners, Generale des Eaux chairman Jean-Marie Messier confirmed on Wednesday.
A spokesman for Alcatel said the timing of the disposal was still not decided.

Alcatel's disposal is being carried out in conjuction with Generale des Eaux's talks with other major international groups interested in taking a stake in Cegetel, the new telecommunications holding announced by Messier.
"Alcatel's exit from Cofira will be carried out to the benefit of strategic partners who will have part of Cegetel," he told a news conference.
"Cofira will only have a role as a pure intermediate holding company, owned nearly exclusively by Cegetel," he said.
Generale des Eaux will hold a majority of Cegetel but the capital of the company will also be open to the diversified utility's "strategic partners", he said.
These partners are notably Southwestern Bell of the U.S. and Britain's Vodafone which hold stakes in Cofira in which CGE is the majority shareholder.
Messier said the makeup of Cegetel's capital would be decided by year end.
Last March, Alcatel chairman Serge Tchuruk announced that the company would cede its stake in Cofira as part of a major asset disposal programme.
